p:
3. Ying Liu, et al
60
The study provided an estimate of the average
R o for COVID‚Äê19 from a period of January 1, 2020 to February 7, 2020.
The authors have argued that the estimation of
R o mainly depends on the estimation technique involved and the modeling assumptions used.
Both deterministic and stochastic models were included in the study.
The study showed an average base reproduction number ( R o) to be equal to 3.28 with a median of 2.79.
